text: Neal Casal (November 2, 1968 – August 26, 2019)Neal Casal Dead: Circles Around the Sun Guitarist Dies at 50: Heavy.com. Retrieved August, 27, 2019. was an American rock guitarist, singer-songwriter and photographer. Casal was born in Denville, New Jersey. He was known as the guitarist for Rickey Medlocke's Blackfoot from 1988 to 1993 and as a member of Ryan Adams' backing band the Cardinals from 2005 until 2009. He played in several groups, including the Chris Robinson Brotherhood, Hard Working Americans, The Skiffle Players, GospelbeacH and Circles Around the Sun – and released twelve albums as a solo artist. Casal killed himself on August 26, 2019 at the age of 50. ==References== ==Other websites== * Neal Casal's official website * Chris Robinson Brotherhood News, Reviews and More Category:1968 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Suicides by hanging in the United States Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American photographers Category:American rock singers Category:American rock guitarists Category:American pianists Category:American rock drummers Category:Singers from New Jersey Category:Writers from New Jersey Category:Musicians from New Jersey
title: Neal Casal
